posts.title: Join Phat Tire For A Group Ride To The Gulley Park Concert Series
posts.content:
Make an entrance at tonight's Gulley Park Concert in a group ride led by Phat Tire Fayetteville. Kids, families, couples, singles – everyone is welcome for this no-drop ride.

  • Ride up: Riders can meet at Phat Tire at 6:30p for a leisurely 4-mi ride to Gulley Park, where they can snag free stickers at the City Park Tent and use the complimentary bike valet.
  • Rock on: This week, the Gulley Park Concert Series continues with four-piece bluegrass sensation Arkansauce, the NWA Mini Makers Market, and an array of food trucks.

Join one of the best summer rides with Phat Tire Bike Shop HERE!

posts.title: Crystal Bridges Launches Innovative Remuseum Project
posts.photoCredit: Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art
posts.content:
Yesterday, Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art announced its launch of Remuseum, a three-year project intended to help U.S. museums become more relevant, sustainable, and in tune with their mission to serve their communities.

  • Innovative approach: Led by Founding Director Stephen Reily, Remuseum will use data to challenge museums to break conventions and create new approaches to relevance, governance, and financial sustainability — funding for the project is led by arts patron David Booth and additional support from the Ford Foundation.
  • ​ Visionary vision: Inspired by the unconventional spirit of Crystal Bridges and a commitment to provide radical access to amazing art experiences, Remuseum hopes to amplify that same spirit of innovation in museums nationwide.

Learn more about the Remuseum project HERE.

posts.title: Learn The Basics Of Paddleboarding At Lake Atalanta
posts.content:
Learn how to paddleboard with instructors from Cocoon Yoga Lab during the Paddle & Play session at Lake Atalanta in Rogers this Saturday, Jun 23, from 4-5:30p.

  • SUP 101: The class breaks down the basics of Stand-Up Paddleboarding in a relaxing group setting, including paddle height and hand placement, equipment overview, kneeling and standing on a board, and water safety. Boards, paddles, and life vests are included.
  • Find your flow: Once you master the basics, take your SUP skills to the next level with one of Cocoon Yoga Lab's Float Yoga classes hosted most weekends. This Saturday, Jun 24, enjoy Flow Yoga from 8:30-10a or Yin Yoga from 10:15-11:45a.

Book your spot for Float Yoga HERE.

posts.title: Siloam Springs's June Fourth Friday Is Bike Night
posts.content:
Siloam Springs will celebrate this month's Fourth Friday with the theme Bike Night at Memorial Park on Jun 23 from 4-8p.

  • Party town: Gather with the community for a night of live music, food trucks & vendors, family activities, and fun with other bike enthusiasts.
  • Wheely cool: Decorate your bike and show it off during the bike parade at 6p, then circle back to the Chautauqua Amphitheater for a night of jazz and swing dancing with the NWA Jazz & More Orchestra at 6:30p.

Find out more information HERE.

posts.title: Celebrate Summer With $40 Tickets To Brothers Osborne At The Momentary
posts.content:
The Momentary is celebrating the start of summer with a flash sale on tickets to see Brothers Osborne perform on Jul 15.

  • Here's the duo: Brothers Osborne is a Grammy Award-winning country-rock duo whose unique sound has earned nine Grammy nominations, numerous CMA and ACM awards, and recognition as one of Nashville's most distinct acts.
  • Here's the deal: No discount code is needed for the sale. Just snag your $40 tickets online before the flash sale ends tomorrow, Jun 23, at 10a.

Don't miss the sale! Buy your tickets HERE.
